most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.3.0 Update Causes Issues
common_issues.description: Users report two main issues after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0: login failures and database corruption. Login attempts get stuck in an infinite loop on the authentication page. Database errors prevent the application from starting. Proposed solutions include using the 'Connect Account' button in the Pieces Toolbar for login and contacting support for database issues. The Pieces team is actively investigating both issues.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Conversation Summary:

**Key points raised:**

* Users are unable to link their Google accounts after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0 on Windows 11.
* Authentication process gets stuck on `https://authentication.pieces.services/` with infinite loading.
* Issue affects both Pieces Desktop and Pieces Toolbar login attempts.
* Users have tried logging in with both Google and Github accounts.

**Problems identified:**

* Authentication flow is broken after the recent update.
* Manual refresh of the `https://authentication.pieces.services/` page causes issues with the callback process.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team is investigating the issue and will provide a fix soon.
* Users are advised to use the 'Connect Account' button in the Pieces Toolbar for login attempts.
* If further assistance is needed, users can schedule a support call with `mark-at-pieces`.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Pieces team has identified the issue and is working on a fix.
* Users are recommended to use the alternative login method or contact support for further assistance.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue specifically affects Windows 11 users.
* Screen recordings provided by users are helpful in troubleshooting the issue.
* Users are encouraged to share their support logs for further investigation.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @antoine79 experienced an issue with their Pieces database upon initial bootup.
* They were willing to delete the database entirely and needed assistance locating it.
* The issue still persisted even after uninstalling the application and deleting the database folder.

**Problems Identified:**

* An issue with the initial bootup of the user's database prevented Pieces from functioning correctly.
* The exact cause of the issue was not immediately apparent.
* Even after deleting the database, the problem persisted, indicating a potential deeper issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces support team offered to debug the issue in real-time via a scheduled call.
* They provided instructions on how to locate the database folder for manual deletion.
* The team is internally investigating the issue and working on a potential fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is actively being investigated and addressed by the Pieces team.
* A solution is not yet available, but the team is actively working on a fix.
* The user is awaiting a resolution from the Pieces support team.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of readily available support resources for software issues.
* The collaborative approach between the user and the support team demonstrates a proactive effort towards resolving the problem. 
* The lack of a current solution suggests the issue might be complex and require further investigation.

recommendations: Investigate and resolve the authentication issue causing login failures after the Pieces OS 11.3.0 update.
Investigate and resolve the database corruption issue preventing Pieces OS from starting after the 11.3.0 update.
Provide clear instructions to users on how to resolve database corruption issues, including potential workarounds like database recovery or reinstallation.
Consider implementing a more robust database backup and recovery system to mitigate the impact of database corruption issues.
Improve communication with users regarding ongoing issues and their estimated resolution timeframes, particularly for critical issues like login failures and database corruption.
